Reference¶

Style¶

class ttkbootstrap.styler.Style(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: tkinter.ttk.Style

A class that sets the theme for an instance of TK. This should be used as a replacement for the normal ttk.Style class. It also supports the default themes provided.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

load_themes()[source]¶

Load all ttkbootstrap defined themes

theme_use(themename=None)[source]¶

If themename is None, returns the theme in use, otherwise, set the current theme to themename, refreshes all widgets and emits a <<ThemeChanged>> event.

Parameters

themename (str) – the theme to apply when creating new widgets

StylerTTK¶

class ttkbootstrap.styler.StylerTTK(style, settings)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to create and apply a flat theme to ttk widgets by using a combination of built-in themes and some image-based elements using pillow.

The base theme of all ttkbootstrap themes is the built-in clam theme. In many cases, widget layouts are re-created using an assortment of elements from various styles such as clam, alt, default, etc…

Parameters

  • style (Style) – An instance of ttk.Style class

  • settings (ThemeSettings) – creates the settings for the theme to be created

__init__(style, settings)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

create_theme()[source]¶

Create and style a new ttk theme. A wrapper around internal style methods.

ThemeSettings¶

class ttkbootstrap.styler.ThemeSettings(name='default', type='light', font='helvetica', colors=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to provide settings for a ttkbootstrap theme.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the theme

  • type (str) – type: ‘light’ or ‘dark’

  • font (str) – Default font to apply to theme. Helvetica is used by default.

  • colors (Color) – An instance of the Colors class.

__init__(name='default', type='light', font='helvetica', colors=None)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

Colors¶

class ttkbootstrap.styler.Colors(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

A collection of colors used in a ttkbootstrap theme.

Parameters

  • primary (str) – the primary theme color; is used as basis for all widgets

  • secondary (str) – an accent color; typically the same as selectbg in built-in themes

  • success (str) – an accent color; an orange hue in most themes

  • info (str) – an accent color; a blue hue in most themes

  • warning (str) – an accent color; an orange hue in most themes

  • danger (str) – an accent color; a red hue in most themes

  • bg (str) – background color; used for root window background

  • fg (str) – primary font color; used for labels and non-input related widgets

  • selectfg (str) – foreground color of selected text

  • selectbg (str) – background color of selected text background

  • light (str) – a color used for input widget background and trough color

  • border (str) – a color used on the border of several input widgets (combobox, entry, spinbox, etc…)

  • inputfg (str) – a color used for input widgets; typically a reverse lightness of fg

__init__(**kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

__repr__()[source]¶

Return repr(self).

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

Parameters

color_label (str) – a color label corresponding to a class propery (primary, secondary, success, etc…)

Returns

a hexadecimal color value

Return type

str

label_iter()[source]¶

Iterates over all color label properties in the Color class

Returns

an iterator representing the name of the color properties

Return type

iter[str]

set(color_label, color_value)[source]¶

Set a color property

Parameters

  • color_label (str) – the name of the color to be set (key)

  • color_value (str) – a hexadecimal color value

Example:

set('primary', '#fafafa')

StylerTk¶

class ttkbootstrap.styler.StylerTK(parent)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that applies theme colors to standard tkinter widgets (not ``ttk`` widgets). Used as a mix-in for StylerTTK.

This class is not intended to be used independent of StylerTTK, though it could. It is meant to serve as a means to format the few widgets that are used in conjunction with the TTK widgets, such as the popdownlist in the ttk.Combobox, and others like this.

Parameters

parent – an instance of StylerTTK

__init__(parent)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

apply_style()[source]¶

A wrapper on all widget style methods. Applies current theme to all standard tkinter widgets
